Notes: Single-seat variant with RBE2-AA AESA radar (200+ km detection), 4-6 Meteor missiles (150 km ramjet, Mach 4+ large NEZ), and SPECTRA EW for fire-and-forget BVR; 18 delivered in 2025 (total 54 toward 114); No. 17 Sqn at Ambala, excels in networked ops with Netra cueing to 140 km despite vendor mix.

Two-seat variant with identical RBE2-AA and Meteor loads for advanced tactics/cooperative BVR; supports drone integration (nEUROn trials); 2025 deliveries boost to 18 operational across 2 squadrons, enhancing two-ship formations in contested airspace.

Heavy twin-engine with Bars-R AESA (200 km), 8-12 RVV-AE-PD/R-77M missiles (120-200 km active, datalink mid-course), and thrust-vectoring; Super-30 upgrades (84 complete 2025) add BrahMos for stand-off BVR; No. 30 Sqn at Lohegaon, core fleet for 140 km envelopes via Falcon AWACS.

Upgraded to 2000-5I std. with RDY-2 radar (150 km), 4-6 MICA-NG missiles (100 km dual-mode AESA/IR), and mid-life updates for datalink; No. 1 Sqn at Gwalior, sustains volume in mixed ops, integrated with Israeli Spice for precision BVR strikes.

Upgraded Fulcrum with Zhuk-ME radar (160 km), 6 R-77 missiles (110 km active), and conformal tanks for extended loiter; UPG mods (2025) enhance ECCM/datalink; No. 47 Sqn at Adampur, cost-effective QRA filler for forward defense.

Indigenous lightweight with EL/M-2032 radar (150 km on Mk1A), 4-6 Astra Mk1 missiles (110 km active, HOBS); Mk1A IOC 2025 with 12 delivered (31 Mk1 +12 Mk1A); No. 18 Sqn at Nal, boosts local sustainment for 120 km BVR via Uttam AESA upgrades.

AEW&C with EL/M-2052 AESA (250-400 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course Meteor/R-77 updates; Mk1A upgrades (2025) add IFF Mode 5; AWACS unit at Bangalore, critical enabler despite low numbers, extending kill chains to 140 km.

MRTT with probe refueling for 2+ hour BVR extensions on Rafale/Su-30; MKI mods add Israeli avionics; No. 320 Sqn at Gwalior, sustains long-range patrols in Indian Ocean theater via mixed-vendor datalinks.
